column4: I'm developing a gtk app to run in ubuntu, in a device with 800x480 screen size. I want to preview how it appearence will be. how can I set my notebook to have a 800x480 screen? this size is not available in the monitor configuration.
why won't you just set the size of your window to 800x480?
all app windows work in "fullscreen" mode
but, when debugging, you can set them to that size, won't you?
not so easy to do... fullscreen windows have different toolboxes/menus behaviour
if I install ubuntu inside a virtualbox, could I set the screensize to 800x480? does it make some difference between a real video card and a virtualbox video card?
I'd check it, but I'm working now on the system without virtualbox, trying to isolate one nasty bug :)
but you surely will have your program in full-screen mode
while it will be in virtualbox window
just out of curiosity, why the window must be exactly 800x480?
do you plan to support another screen resolutions?
because it is a touchscreen device... just 800x480 is available
i mean, don't you plan to run it on different devices?
no, it is a dedicated equipment for lab purposes. I just don't have it with me right now... on monday I can run on the real device. today I'll have to develop with my notebook only :-)
i see :) good luck to you
